If kidneys do not work well, toxic waste and extra fluid accumulate in the body and may lead to Hypertension, Heart disease, stroke, and early death. People with chronic kidney disease may not feel ill or notice any symptoms until chronic kidney disease is advanced. The only way to find out if people have chronic kidney disease is through simple Blood and Urine tests. The Blood test checks for the level of Creatinine, a waste product produced by muscles, to see how well the kidneys work. The Urine test checks for Protein, which may indicate Kidney damage.
